frameDefinitions: There is a gradable amount of light in a particular Location.
A Phenomenon is portrayed with respect to the Degree of likelihood that it will  be perceived and known, given the (usually implicit)
An Entity is judged by a sound Attribute of some perceived level of Volume intensity.
A Sound emitted by a  Sound_source, which construed as a single point, moves along a Path.
A volitionally acting Interceptor takes control, without being authorized to do so by the sender, of a Theme that is underway from a sender to a recipient.
A Speaker realizes a Sign, usually a linguistic one, in some Formal_realization.
frameExamples: The small print was bearly readable by the light of the very <t>dim</t> torch.
It's abundantly <t>obvious</t> that we'll need to spend more time on public perception.
Her shouts <t>echoed</t> around the cylinder formed by the walls.
Police <t>intercepted</t> the call and raided the address.
A person doesn't always <t>pronounce</t> a word the way they say  it in context
listRoleDefinitions: The place whose amout of light is being described.  The <fen>Location</fen> can also be a location in time, as seen in the second example below:
The entity from which the light eminates.
The entity or facts that are undeniable given the <fen>Evidence</fen>.
The gradable aspect of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen> which concerns how likely it is that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> be known. This frame element is incorporated by the lexical units in this frame.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> from the norm or from the value for another <fen>Phenomenon</fen> in terms of how likely the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> would be known.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is obvious
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the sound level <fen>Attribute</fen> is under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under consideration. This role is incorporated in each LU in the frame.
A quantity or characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s sound output with repspect to its <fen>Attribute</fen>.
A modifier expressing the deviation of the <fen>Volume</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Volume</fen> for the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The place where an <fen>Entity</fen> is located.
A percept produced  in hearing organs by  vibrations which travel through the air or another medium.
The location of the Sound_source from which the <fen>Sound</fen> travels
The Path of the Sound's movement is any description of its trajectory of motion which is neither a Location_of_sound_source or a Goal.
The point-like entity which produces the <fen>Sound</fen>.
A description of the location where the <fen>Sound</fen> ends up.
The time when  the <fen>Sound</fen> movement occurs.
A setting in which <fen>Sound</fen> movement happens.
The volitional agent who without authorization of sender or recipient takes control of a <fen>Theme</fen> that is en route to a destination.
The entity, physical or abstract, construed as traveling from a sender to a goal location, which is taken hold of by the <fen>Interceptor</fen> without permission.
The time period during which the <fen>Interceptor</fen> takes control of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Interceptor</fen> takes control of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The language user who produces a <fen>Sign</fen> in some modality.
An abstract form-meaning pairing.
An evaluation of whether the <fen>Formal_realization</fen> that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produced matches the standard or standard range.
The written string, gesture, or vocalized sound sequence that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces.
A constituent part of the <fen>Formal_realization</fen>.
The way that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Formal_realization</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Formal_realization</fen>.
listRoleExamples: She hid from the man in a dark <fex>corner</fex>.
A dim <fex>lamp</fex> swung over the entrance to the castle.
It is obvious for example <fex>that 9/10 is not the same as 1</fex>.
It is <fex>abundantly</fex> obvious you have not a clue how the Retro Program works.
It is obvious <fex>now</fex> that Senator O. T. Tawa has no plan.
<fex>Laughter</fex> echoed through the halls
The Prince 's laugh echoed <fex>from the corridor</fex>.
A loud bang echoed <fex>through the valley</fex>.
There was muzak echoing <fex>from cheap speakers</fex>.
<fex>In the mornings</fex> the harsh , squawking voices of the gulls echo between the channel walls
I heard their footsteps echo <fex>in the hollow cavern</fex>.
Two days later, <fex>an aerial patrol</fex> intercepted an enemy trying the same thing.
They could either sail west down the Channel or north-east to intercept <fex>an enemy making for the Thames estuary</fex>.
The five had been intercepted <fex>after a DFLP attack on March 5</fex>.
She had been intercepted <fex>outside Guy 's room</fex> and would be severely punished.
<fex>He</fex> insists on mispronouncing my name every time, the bastard!
My little nephew can't say <fex>prestidigitation</fex>
Finally, I would pay more attention to your 'oppinion' if you spelled it <fex>correctly</fex>.
The old uncensored editions of the Talmud referred to Jesus as Yeshua censored versions spelled it <fex>as Yeshu</fex>
You spelled it <fex>with a 't'</fex>.
You spelled it <fex>the way it sounds</fex>.
<fex>Today</fex> you spelled it 'pjuok'.
